quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So when they ignore prevention, they’re effectively gambling with my life.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and I’ve told them that’s not acceptable practice.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Not acceptable is too soft. It’s negligence.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: You’re right, it is negligent when prevention is ignored.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: Negligence that puts me at risk every day.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I agree, and I’ll continue to stress that to them.

contradictions.issue: Victim frames ignored prevention as negligence risking life; advocate concedes negligence but only 'stresses' point
